intro: Polypogon chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean grass or Chilean flat grass, is a perennial grass species native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands, coastal areas, and disturbed soils. The plant has slender, spreading stems and narrow, blade-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a dense, spike-like cluster of small, two-lobed flowers. Polypogon chilensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
